{{Infobox military person |image= Dilbag singh.jpg | |name= Air Chief Marshal Dilbagh Singh |birth_date= March 10, 1926 |death_date={{Death date and age|2001|02|09|1926|3|10|df=yes}} |birth_place= [[Shakargarh]] [[Gurdaspur district]] [[Punjab (India)|Punjab]] |death_place= Dehradun, Uttarakhand, India |caption= |nickname= |allegiance={{flagicon|India}} [[India]] |serviceyears= 1945-1984 |rank= [[Air Chief Marshal]] |branch= {{air force|India}} |commands= [[Eastern Air Command, Indian Air Force|Eastern Air Command]]
[[Ambala Air Force Station]] |unit= [[No. 1 Squadron IAF|No. 1 Squadron]] |battles= |awards= |laterwork= }} Air Chief Marshal '''Dilbagh Singh''' PVSM, AVSM, VM (March 10, 1926 – February 9, 2001) was the head of the [[Indian Air Force]] from 1981 to 1984,http://www.bharat-rakshak.com/IAF/Personnel/Chiefs/261-Dilbagh-Singh.html as [[Chief of the Air Staff (India)|Chief of the Air Staff]]. He was the second [[Sikh]] to hold that position. Dilbagh Singh was commissioned as a pilot in 1944. His operational flying career spanned the [[Supermarine Spitfire|Spitfire]] to introducing the [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21|MiG-21]] into service in India. He had earlier made the first official [[Sonic boom|"Supersonic Bang"]] over India in [[New Delhi]] when the [[Dassault Mystère IV|Mystere IV-A]] was showcased in a public demonstration. He served as India’s [[Ambassador]] to [[Brazil]] from 1985 to 1987. == References == ==External links== * [http://www.tribuneindia.com/2001/20010211/nation.htm#11 ''Ex-Air Chief Dilbagh Singh dead'', The Tribune, Feb 11, 2001] * [http://www.bharat-rakshak.com/IAF/History/Air-Chiefs/Chiefs-Air-11.html Air Chiefs, www.bharat-rakshak.com] * [http://www.bharat-rakshak.com/IAF/History/1940s/Sikhs.html Sikh Pilots in the Indian Air Force in World War Two, www.bharat-rakshak.com] {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{s-bef|before=[[Idris Latif]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Chief of the Air Staff (India)]] |years=1981–1984}} {{s-aft|after=[[Lakshman Katre]]}} {{end}} {{Chief_of_the_Air_Staff_(India)}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Singh, Dilbagh}} [[Category:Indian aviators]] [[Category:Chiefs of Air Staff (India)]] [[Category:Indian Air Force air marshals]] [[Category:1926 births]] [[Category:2001 deaths]] [[Category:People from Gurdaspur]] [[Category:Indian Sikhs]] [[Category:Military personnel from Punjab, India]] [[Category:Ambassadors of India to Brazil]] [[Category:Recipients of the Param Vishisht Seva Medal]] [[Category:Recipients of the Ati Vishisht Seva Medal]] [[Category:Indian Air Force officers]] {{India-mil-bio-stub}}
